channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @bernstein_judah Computer-assisted self-radicalization, without any communal element. Bombing Alone, as Roger Putnam might say.
@prof_dainy What book?
@BGrueskin Certainly, we here in Jersey have sent you worse.
@lymanstoneky Could the missiles have hit an ammunition store?
@BurtonJM @PeterBeinart Community Relations tips of the sages.
This looks cool. https://t.co/w5dUg88xaL
@LivitUpLeo @bfry1981 @RALee85 If you’re using nukes, the only navy you need is the subs. If you’re not using nukes, the nukes aren’t a factor.
@tromyam @EladNehorai @AIPAC @jstreetdotorg @JewishStandard Yes you can.

@tromyam @EladNehorai @AIPAC @jstreetdotorg @JewishStandard A more analytical critique would be welcomed.
@tromyam @EladNehorai @AIPAC @jstreetdotorg @JewishStandard (I will note that for all his evincing concern about “liberal” causes, he has never penned an op ed for us espousing one.)
Best tweet ever. https://t.co/tUG4QTptdz
@KatHumanArt @sarahmhop Laughing in HS class of ‘81.

This is the present Republicans want. Hard to believe a party that elected a pedophile as Speaker of the House would traumatize kids, but there you have it. https://t.co/klZOYT5Yit
https://t.co/Qmkn3QDg1k
Looks like 5 out of 6 Republican Jews are perfectly fine with would-be president-for-life Donald Trump. https://t.co/bPAp1YYNeh
Note the role of the Times in spreading easily refuted Republican beliefs. https://t.co/cWU9i0Pi3S
@lavietidhar Or at least of the world.
A question for Yiddishist / linguists / Jewish journalists: When someone uses a Yeshivish word like "achrayus," should it be described as "Hebrew" or "Yiddish"?
Would be interesting to see the overlap between those damning @IfNotNowOrg as “traitors״ and those promoting the various Black Republican Zionists. https://t.co/f1ukqGcdlC
@kampeas Editors publish the pieces their publishers want them to publish.
@jamesdnicoll Translated from which language?
@EladNehorai If only we had a book of the Bibi’s with the theme of ever again. Maybe we could read it on Sukkot.
@gorskon @MarkHoofnagle Early in my parenting days, I ran across a similar sentiment, translated from a 3000 year old tablet.
